Mr. Furious.Action: Confronts the gang to protect a youngster, insists they are superheroes despite ridicule.
Rushes headlong into a fight against multiple crooks to defend teammates, holding his own despite being outnumbered.
Shows defiance toward enemies even while being crushed, delivering a taunt 'Your mother!'
Rushes directly into oncoming crooks with furious determination and holds his own for a while, taking out multiple enemies with powerful punches.
Continues fighting even when outnumbered and is eventually taken down by being crushed under a large opponent, showing resilience but no tactical retreat or evasion.
Responds to being crushed with defiant verbal taunts rather than attempting to escape or counter, showing confidence but lack of strategic thinking.
Growls at the cops mocking him and fellow heroes, showing frustration and protective instincts.
Does not intervene or speak up when Captain Amazing ignores the other heroes, contributing to their humiliation.
Growls threateningly at cops who mock and dismiss the superheroes.
Allows himself and team to be mocked and dismissed by police, failing to assert their legitimacy.
Growls at cops who ridicule them.
Expresses anger and frustration about a perceived fake hero.
Insists loudly that the real identity of Captain Amazing has been uncovered, showing passion and conviction.
Engages with teammates in shared frustration and camaraderie.
Displays intolerance for perceived injustice and hypocrisy in Captain Amazing.
Growsl at cops who mock them, gets pulled away before causing trouble.
Identifies and exposes Captain Amazing's secret identity with certainty and confidence.
Encourages Raja to be honest with his mother about lost forks.
Shows frustration over trivial things (napkin dispenser), indicating internal tension but no outward hostility towards others.
Appears shy and smitten under his rage when interacting with the waitress Monica, showing a softer, more vulnerable side.
Responds to Monica's question with a growl, showing brusqueness despite underlying shyness.
Watches Monica with interest, despite his anger.
Expresses frustration about relationships and shows vulnerability in describing his emotional struggles.
Rejects the idea of going on a date and shows distrust towards women, believing they want to control him and ultimately dump him.
Approaches Monica and leans on counter but remains silent and fuming, causing awkwardness.
Invites Monica to go out for drinks or talk despite his anger, showing an attempt at connection.
Responds to romantic suggestion with sarcasm and brushes off advice, showing defensive and dismissive attitude.
Leaves interaction abruptly after rejection, not pressing further or showing emotional vulnerability.
Fuming and unable to think of anything to say when wanting to talk to someone.
Attempts to engage Monica by suggesting going out to get drunk or talk despite her being visibly turned off.
Rejects advice to try a more romantic approach (like flowers) with a sarcastic comment and leaves abruptly.
Sits drinking alone, expresses cynicism and despair about dreams and success.
Follows Captain Amazing without question, showing interest and engagement.
Defends the Herkimer Battle Jitney as a classic and valuable despite Sally wanting to break it down for iron.
Throws away his iron bar and chooses not to damage the old vehicle, showing tenderness toward it.
Sits with friends and shares concern about missing millionaire Lance Hunt, showing engagement and care.
Groans in response to uncertainty, showing frustrated but invested emotional reaction.
Dismisses Casanova’s claim of change flatly, showing skepticism and possible cynicism.
Hears a suspicious sound and makes the group stop to listen.
Notices the slightly open French door and leads the group to sneak toward it.
Fails to prevent tripping the automatic security lighting that exposes the group.
Fights fiercely to protect himself and others during the attack.
Does not retaliate after being released and kicked by enemies; no vengeful or aggressive comments shown.
Holds his own in the fight initially by grabbing a pipe and swinging fiercely, keeping attackers off.
Is caught off guard and stunned by Casanova's chain attack, leading to being strangled and ultimately kicked while incapacitated.
No demonstrated recovery or counteraction after being downed; remains in bad shape and moaning with teammates.
Encourages forming a brotherhood of superheroes to fight crime together.
Dismisses doing the right thing as an afterthought to fame and fortune.
Shows inclusive initiative by wanting to summon all unsung superheroes.
Mockingly mentions recruiting unpopular or odd superheroes (like the Spleen).
Sees capturing Casanova as a crucial opportunity and motivates the team to take action.
Suggests forming a 'brotherhood' to increase their strength and impact.
Dismisses concerns about being outnumbered by the Brotherhood of Evil with confident optimism.
Suggests calling on unreliable or questionable allies like the Spleen and Shoveler's invisible cousin without critical evaluation.
Does not provide a clear plan or actionable steps beyond vague ideas of recruiting others.
Writes a message on a napkin as a clever way to contact a mysterious ally.
Carefully confirms the spelling of the contact's name before sending the message.
Engages in clear, logical questioning to fully understand Invisible Boy's power limitations.
Expresses belief in and optimism about the existence of many lonely, unknown superheroes who need a cause
Recognizes the potential of unknown superheroes and is optimistic about finding them a cause.
Engages in planning with group for recruiting more heroes, showing leadership and strategic thinking.
Does not intervene or correct the ridiculous behavior of the Spleen that disrupts their dinner, indicating possible tolerance or lack of control.
Tapes the invitation note to a vandalized phone booth, participating in the effort to recruit other heroes.
Chugs beer, works himself into a morose mood, expresses cynicism about good vs evil and attendees showing up.
Questions the difference between good and evil, shows doubt and frustration with the group's purpose.
Dismisses Raja's encouragement with 'Oh shut up.'
Watches Invincible Dudes disrespectfully toss away forms, starts to get pissed off.
Confronts Squeegee Man and challenges him to fly, showing a protective attitude towards the setting.
Watches others disregard instructions and becomes visibly angry, showing awareness of disorder.
Confronts a disruptive character (Squeegee Man) and challenges him logically about his powers.
Provokes Squeegee Man into revealing a latent ability by betting on his capacity to fly.
Does not prevent or control the chaos caused by the Invincible Dudes despite recognizing issues early on.
No direct action or involvement in the scene; remains dejected and miserable with others.
Invites Bowler to have a beer with him, initiating friendly interaction.
Expresses anger at the villains threatening Bowler and the group.
Responds aggressively to concern about being outnumbered ('SO WHAT?').
Casually approaches Bowler and confidently asks to buy her a beer, initiating social interaction smoothly.
Expresses anger about the villains (Disco Boys) starting to 'piss him off' and shows determination despite being outnumbered.
Dismisses concerns about being outnumbered by saying 'So what?'
Demolishes the villains' limo aggressively, checks the car's oil with a sarcastic remark, compliments the heroes' getaway vehicle.
Goes on a demolition rampage, effectively disables the villains' limo by punching dents, breaking windows, flattening tires, and knocking off the mirror.
Leaps on top of the limo and checks the car's oil using the dipstick, showing situational awareness and cleverness.
Leaps off the limo just as a shot explodes the windshield, avoiding injury and landing safely on another vehicle.
Engages in reckless physical destruction without apparent planning or strategic restraint.
Sits alone in the corner, brooding, lost in his own angry thoughts.
Accepts rescue from the Sphinx without protest and acknowledges him.
Sulks silently when reprimanded by the Sphinx, showing no argument or defiance.
Sulked quietly when others turned against him, showing sensitivity to group dynamics.
Responded angrily to others' comments about Superman, showing frustration but no hostility.
Throws a look at the Shoveler and Raja, judging that Doctor Heller is 'out of it' and they are wasting their time.
Turns and leaves abruptly when others engage in enthusiasm, showing unwillingness to share in group excitement.
Responds to teasing from Bowler by catching the tossed can without hostility, but visibly angry afterward.
Muttering angrily and violently kicking the empty can, making others keep their distance.
Successfully fires the air cannon and destroys the old shed despite the recoil knocking him back.
Proposes a direct assault on Casanova's house with the new weapon, showing decisiveness but ignoring the group's consensus.
Refuses to join the team's training, isolates himself by drinking alone and brooding while the others improve their teamwork and fighting skills.
Rejects his companions harshly, tells them he doesn't need them, leaves alone.
Remembers himself as a sweet, shy, well-behaved child playing quietly.
His parents abandon him locked in a hot car while they drink inside the bar, ignoring his distress.
Little Furious shows fear and seeks help from his parents by pounding on the windows and calling to them.
Tries to escape the car by attempting to open the automatic windows.
Becomes trapped in the car, suffering heat and fear, unable to get help due to parents' inattention.
Instinctively channels his fear into rage, showing an internal defense mechanism.
Crushes his superhero figurines in frustration and anger, showing loss of control.
Sits alone in a diner booth with a look of profound pain and loneliness; responds politely and briefly to Monica's friendly greeting.
Demonstrates no further engagement beyond short answers to Monica, indicating social withdrawal or difficulty in connecting.
Nervously asks Monica out on a date, shows vulnerability and sincerity.
Agrees to walk Monica home after work, showing friendliness and consideration.
Agrees to walk Monica home without hesitation, indicating confidence and straightforwardness.
Appears calm and visible in the brightly lit diner window, unaware or unperturbed that an armed Disco Boy is aiming a pistol at him from the shadows.
Walks Monica home, listens to her without judgment, affirms her choices (e.g., being a waitress, staying in town).
Shares personal details (real name Roy), opens up subtly during conversation.
Engages in tender kiss with Monica after a gentle, sincere moment.
Does not express anger as expected, shows vulnerability when Monica observes him.
Feels emotions he's not used to, really likes Monica.
Caught by surprise and takes a defensive stand with Casanova Frankenstein.
Rejects Casanova's offer to switch teams and decline evil path quietly but firmly.
Takes a stand and is ready to fight when surprised by Casanova Frankenstein, showing alertness and readiness.
Remains silent and quiet in response to Casanova's taunts and offers, indicating self-control and cautiousness.
Quietly but firmly rejects Casanova's offer to switch teams, showing moral integrity and clear decision-making.
Does not immediately engage in a fight or rashly respond to provocation, instead assesses the situation (not explicitly stated but implied by catching movement and responding verbally).
Leaps at Casanova, pins his arms in a bear hug, and holds him in line of fire to protect him from the Disco Bays.
Anticipates the Disco Bays' ambush and uses Casanova as a shield to protect himself and stop the gunfire.
Successfully escapes by running and leaping over a wooden wall under heavy fire, evading his pursuers.
Returns and acknowledges needing his friends, leading to an embrace with Sphinx.
Returns to the group on his own initiative, seeks reconciliation and admits he was wrong.
Engages emotionally and demonstrates self-awareness by expressing need for friends.
Encourages team to be adaptable and clever by suggesting to 'become like the wolf who wears the sheep's clothing' to infiltrate a place.
Leads the group confidently through a challenging situation with camaraderie and teamwork.
Responds with 'I dunno' to a serious question, showing some uncertainty or reticence.
Follows the sound of drunken laughter to investigate cautiously.
Attempts to remain inconspicuous with the group by leaning against the wall.
Shows jealousy visibly when Casanova talks to Monica, which may compromise composure.
Gets jealous but restrains himself to just growling and reacting non-violently.
Calms Monica down by removing his hand from her mouth after reassuring her it's him.
Calms Monica down by removing his hand after reassuring her it's him.
Encourages the group to face overwhelming odds to protect their city, friends, and families, emphasizing doing what's right even when it's impossible.
Motivates team with a clear, determined speech; accepts the dire situation and proposes a direct plan of attack despite overwhelming odds.
Acknowledge limitations openly (not bulletproof, can't fly) while still framing the situation realistically and ethically.
Says 'We'll just have to get lucky' when faced with uncertainty about the enemy's location and appearance.
Takes initiative to hook up and drive the tow truck towing the Battle Jitney off the lot.
Gives a confident rally command 'Go do what you gotta do... Do or die.' to the team before their plan.
Cusses to himself while working under the hood, encourages the engine to start 'Come on, baby...'
Working under the hood of the Herkimer, covered with grease and oil, actively trying to fix the engine.
Cussing to himself while working, indicating frustration but persistence.
Demonstrates mechanical skill and determination by encouraging ignition attempts despite initial failure.
Urgently warns Monica to get out of danger, shows concern for her safety.
Remains silent and taken aback by Monica's courage and confession.
Contemplates nature and loneliness quietly, expresses understanding of shared human vulnerability.
Shows empathy by interpreting the emotions of another (the lover’s anger is gone).
Asks about Monica showing concern for others.
Lies sprawled on the hillside, appearing disengaged from the group's preparation, showing introspection but no active contribution to the immediate situation.
Expresses thoughtful, poetic reflections on loneliness and life, demonstrating emotional insight and self-awareness.
Asks if Monica has called, showing some awareness or concern about external communication or developments.
Calls out that the Shoveler's punch was uncalled for, indicating a level of fairness and respect.
Initially resists getting angry despite pressure from friends, showing emotional restraint and thoughtfulness.
Expresses existential thoughts about normalcy, which may indicate introspection but also detachment.
Behaves confrontationally by getting visibly more angry only after personal possessions are destroyed.
Sits passively under interrogation, does not initially respond with anger or assertiveness when urged by teammates.
Questions concept of 'normal' with introspective and philosophical comments, showing depth and thoughtfulness.
Responds calmly and wittily after being physically struck (calling Shoveler's punch 'really uncalled for').
Expresses genuine anger only after personal belongings are destroyed, indicating difficulty in self-motivating or controlling emotions initially.
Once angered, he asserts his mood clearly and seriously ('Okay, you win. I'm pissed off. I'm seriously peeved.')
Wears headphones loudly playing music, shows strong emotional reaction by weeping at the beauty of the music, despite others being hopeful for a positive outcome.
Wears headphones to test a new device; writhes and groans indicating an intense reaction to the music, demonstrating endurance and commitment.
Breaks down emotionally, weeping over the music, causing the group to collectively groan in defeat.
Expresses concern that Monica might still call for help.
Shoves Shoveler abruptly to take the driver's seat.
Insists on driving despite opposition and acts confidently in a tense moment.
Ignores the team member's objections and forcibly shoves Shoveler into the vehicle.
Closes his eyes and tries to get mad, but fails hopelessly.
Rides in the Herkimer which aggressively forces open the front gate by crashing through it and then ascends the stairs under gunfire, showing fearless engagement with the mission.
Watches anxiously while others prepare and fight actively; does not take initiative or contribute actively in the battle.
Looks up and calls out to Monica when he hears her voice from above.
Eagerly attempts to run through the arch despite the danger from the laser eye until stopped by Doc Heller.
Quickly recognizes Monica's voice and looks up attentively.
Despite desperation and near tears, uses sheer determination and rage to pull himself up the sheer wall, showing physical capability and mental tenacity.
Nearly loses grip and dangles by fingertips, indicating a lack of sure-footedness or climbing skill, but recovers through sheer rage.
Intervenes to protect Frankenstein from Casanova despite being wounded and in pain.
Lunges aggressively at Casanova and throws away a gun after disarming the enemy.
Engages in violent physical combat, showing intense rage and aggression toward Casanova.
Despite being initially overpowered and having his throat crushed, he maintains focus and retaliates effectively, overpowering Casanova and hurling him into a chandelier.
Crushes the nerve center of the Psychostridulator decisively to protect others.
Drops to his knees wounded and exhausted but checks on Monica tenderly, embracing her when she wakes.
Affirms identity and purpose to the group with 'It doesn't matter what we call ourselves. We know who we are.'
Calls the group to action with 'Amigos, duty calls.'

Furious.Action: Invites the group to go eat at White Castle together before the attack.
Attempts to speak lightheartedly ('Disco sucks') in a dire situation, showing sardonic camaraderie.
